concept.title: Network and ACLs
concept.shortdesc: Security outside Couchbase Server involves the configuration of IP tables and ports.

conbody.p: Security best practices include encrypting certain data locations using transparent data encryption technologies. These technologies are offered by 3rd party on-disk encryption software vendors, such as Vormetric. To see more details, see the webinar provided at Understanding Database Encryption with Couchbase and Vormetric.

ul.li: Data and index file path (the default data path on Linux) at /opt/couchbase/var/lib/couchbase/data.
Allow administrative access to Couchbase Server only through specific machines, e.g., jump servers. To audit access, turn on OS level auditing on these machines.

section.p: Access restriction to the machines must be performed at the network level or the system level using IPtables rules.

section.title: Configuring IP Tables and Ports
section.p: To configure IP tables for Linux, you can choose among one of these two options:

ul.li: Edit the file /etc/sysconfig/iptables: ##allow everyone to access port 80 and 443## -A INPUT -m state --state NEW -p tcp --dport 80 -j ACCEPT -A INPUT -m state --state NEW -p tcp --dport 443 -j ACCEPT

section.p: A sample of the IP tables rules is available in this blog.
